findings.title: The LastTime() Function Can Revert Due To Arithmetic Underflow
findings.description: The lastTime() function attempts to return the difference between the constant value representing day in seconds (86400) and difference between current block.timestamp and user's startTime, However, this function reverts with Arithmetic over/underflow error message whenever 86401 seconds passes since user's startTime was set.

findings.title: F-2023-0147 - Missing Input Validation For Key Parameters
findings.description: The contract's constructor is missing input validation for key parameters: `intervalCount` and `ratioCount`. Both parameters participate in the reward accounting and distribution processes.

findings.title: F-2023-0153 - The Start() Function Lacks Input Validation
findings.description: The `start()` function register or re-register new user in the contract without implementing any input validation.

findings.title: The TotalCumulative State Variable Can Be Calculated Only Once
findings.description: The totalCumulative state variable can be calculated only once as it is based on each registered user's rewardDebt and cannot be updated anymore.

findings.title: F-2023-0155 - Lack of two-step ownership transfer
findings.description: The contract implements single-step ownership transfer functionality, which may result in loss of ownership if transferred to an unverified and incorrect address.

findings.title: The Amount() Function Can Return Inaccurate Value
findings.description: The amount() function can return inaccurate value due to not considering locktime when calculating reward.

findings.title: F-2023-0140 - State Variables Default Visibility
findings.description: Multiple state variables lack explicit visibility declaration, defaulting to internal visibility.

findings.title: F-2023-0141 - Unused Events
findings.description: Unused event declarations consume additional Gas during deployment.

findings.title: F-2023-0142 - Gas Overconsumption In Deposit Mechanism
findings.description: The solution uses `balances` array to track native tokens deposited, which consumes additional Gas and storage slots within the `deposit()` function.

findings.title: Redundant SafeMath Library In Use
findings.description: The `SafeMath` library is redundant and can be removed as Solidity version 0.8.0 introduces arithmetic overflow and underflow protection features, making it unnecessary.

findings.title: The GetCurrentTime() Is Redundant Wrapper
findings.description: The `getCurrentTime()` function appears to be redundant wrapper on `block.timestamp` global variable.

findings.title: F-2023-0148 - Native Tokens Transfer Via The Transfer() Function
findings.description: The mineWOW's functions use builtin `transfer()` function for transferring native tokens. However, it was identified as potentially problematic due to its fixed gas limit of 2300.

findings.title: Lack Of Days Time Unit Usage Across Solution
findings.description: Within the solution multiple instances of literal value representing seconds in a day (86400) were identified and calculated each function call, leading to extensive Gas consumption.

findings.title: F-2023-0150 - Redundant Variable Value Assignments
findings.description: Within the `calculateReward()` function, the `count` variable is assigned twice to 0, which leads to extensive Gas consumption.

findings.title: F-2023-0151 - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: Error messages presented by the solution can be considered misleading as they are inconsistent and do not provide accurate information about the failure reason.

findings.title: F-2023-0152 - Custom Errors In Solidity For Gas Efficiency
findings.description: The finding suggests using custom errors instead of `require` statements with string messages to reduce gas consumption and make contracts more gas-efficient.

findings.title: F-2023-0156 - Redundant Condition Within The Register() Function
findings.description: Within the `register()` function there is a condition check that is redundant (`speed >= 0`). The `speed` variable is a value in a range between 0 and maximum value for `uint256` type, so this condition is always satisfied. Thus, such implementation leads to extensive Gas consumption.

findings.title: F-2023-0170 - Constant Variables Can Be Introduced
findings.description: The `baseQuota` and `baseSpeed` variables have constant values but are not declared as `constant`. Declaring them as `constant` can save gas.

findings.title: F-2023-0171 - Unused State Variables
findings.description: Unused state variable `baseSpeed` declared but never used, increasing Gas consumption during deployment and occupying additional storage slot.
